column4: I'm currently using the demo OS from the 6.06 install CD, when starting up, after mem check my computer displays a blinking '_' and nothing else. What can I do to fix this short of re-installing? I've attempted re-installing GRUB, as well as using the CD's 'boot from first hard drive' option, but neither works.
Just the memcheck? nothing else? (If so Ram problem?)
Sounds really, really dumb, but leave it at the blinking cursor for a LONG time (like 24-48 hours) -- worked for a dead MythTV box some time ago.
Have you installed a new Hard Drive or have a USB stick/CD in?
Oh, OK. Master should be enough.
Maybe open the machine, unplug the slave and reboot?
I got a new SATA and took 2 days to realise my machine was not SATA II compat -- one pin jumper change!  :)
AhA! Windows XP and Vista re-write the boot sector on install?
I read this in a nerd magazine.. wait...
If you install Windows Vista (or XP) ona machine already running Linux, it will overwrtie the Master Boot Record (MBR) without prompting.   Linux Magazine Issue 75
Linux Mag article only says how to save the MBR before you install Windows. Yikes. Nothing on resetting. Maybe Grub re-install?
Maybe use knoppix to save your /home/ then upgrade to Fiesty? (Sorry, out of other ideas!)
Knoppix = LiveCD with k3b for burning disks of data....
Maybe there's a Grub expert here? lHck..?
I trust you've visited the BIOS to check boot order?
